metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1720 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the HTMLBodyElement::insertedInto function in core/html/HTMLBodyElement.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.116, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors involving attributes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> Issue was fixed prior to Oxide r501, the first version to be included in an Ubuntu release

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
